document.discussion_title: Online shop branded ‘sick’ for using face of child killer on its merchandise
document.topic_text: Online shop branded ‘sick’ for using face of child killer on its merchandise An online company has been criticised for using the image of an infamous child murderer on a range of products. American website, society6, is selling t-shirts, hoodies, mobile phone cases and pillows emblazoned with an artist’s impression of Moors killer, Myra Hindley, reports the Manchester Evening News. Illustrator Paul Nelson-Esch, who created the design, has also used the likes of Bjork, Freddie Mercury and Roger Federer in fashion lines. But his latest print has been blasted for being ‘sick’ and ‘twisted’.
